I am a research scientist with over ten years of experience in the fields of genomics, stem cells, and computational biology. My current research focuses on spatial omics and the development of open source software to analyze large-scale scientific datasets. You can learn more about my research on my Google Scholar page and my open source contributions on my GitHub or the Open Source page. I am currently a Hariri Institute Graduate Student Fellow and Ph.D. Candidate at Boston University in the Dries Lab.
